Actions.Name: Importér data til Power BI-tjenesten\Indstil shared expression
Importér data til Power BI-tjenesten\Indstil ét nyt shared expression
Actions.Execute:
/*
Forfatter: Andreas Olsen aols0228, ChatGPT og ...
Link til kilde: https://docs.tabulareditor.com/common/CSharpScripts/Beginner/script-create-m-parameter.html
Beskrivelse: Makro, der opretter et parameter og bagefter fortæller hvordan det kan bruges
Change Log: (udskift denne med dine noter)
---------------------------------------------------------------
Ver. | Dato DD-MM-YYYY | Forfatter | Beskrivelse
1.0    19-06-2024        aols0228    Frigivelse af makro
*/

// This script creates a new M parameter in the 'Shared Expressions (Parametre)' of a model.
//
// Create a new shared expression called "New Parameter"

Model.AddExpression( 
    "New Parameter", 
    @"
""Parameter Text"" meta
[
	IsParameterQuery = true,
	IsParameterQueryRequired = true,
	Type = type text
]"
);

// Provides an output informing how to configure and use the parameter
Info ( 
    "Created a new Shared Expression called 'New Parameter', which is an M Parameter template." + 
    "\n------------------------------------------------------\n" + 
    "To configure:" +
    "\n------------------------------------------------------\n    " + 
    "1. Replace the text 'New Parameter' with the desired parameter value\n    " +
    "2. Set the data type appropriately\n    " +
    "3. Replace any values found in the M partitions with the parameter reference." );

Actions.Name: Importér data til Power BI-tjenesten\Skift til udviklingscluster fm1 (standard)
Actions.Execute:
/*
Forfatter: Andreas Olsen aols0228 og ChatGPT
Link til kilde: 
Beskrivelse: Makro, der opdaterer eksisterende parametre til sandbox-miljøet
    1. It creates a dictionary with key/value pairs of typestring/string with the M parameters you wish to update
    2. If the M parameters do not preexist the script fails
    3. If they exist it fetches the M parameters with the same name as in the dictionary
    3. It then insert the new parameters value for sandbox environment
Change Log: (udskift denne med dine noter)
---------------------------------------------------------------
Ver. | Dato DD-MM-YYYY | Forfatter | Beskrivelse
1.0    19-06-2024        aols0228    Frigivelse af makro
*/

Macro(@"Admin\Server\Produktion");
Macro(@"Admin\Cluster\dap_sql_fm1");

/*
in c# I am not allowed to use only one
I know I can use \
but can I put r in front like in python?


ChatGPT
In C#, if you want to use backslashes in strings without escaping each one with another backslash (\\), you have a couple of options:

Verbatim String Literal (@): Similar to Python's raw strings, you can prefix your string literal with @. This tells C# to interpret the string literally, ignoring escape sequences:

csharp
Kopier kode
string path = @"C:\Users\Username\Documents";
In this example, @"C:\Users\Username\Documents" will be treated as "C:\Users\Username\Documents" without needing to escape the backslashes.

Using Forward Slash (/): In file paths or other contexts where backslashes are commonly used, you can often use forward slashes (/) instead. C# and most modern Windows APIs accept forward slashes in paths as well:

csharp
Kopier kode
string path = "C:/Users/Username/Documents";
This approach works because C# and the underlying APIs can handle paths with forward slashes on Windows.

However, if you absolutely need to use backslashes and prefer not to use verbatim string literals or forward slashes, you would need to escape each backslash with another backslash (\\). There's no direct equivalent to Python's r prefix for raw strings in C#.
*/

Actions.Name: Admin\Headerskabelon
Actions.Execute:
